title: Nisnevich topology
summary: In algebraic geometry, the Nisnevich topology, sometimes called the completely decomposed topology, is a Grothendieck topology on the category of schemes which has been used in algebraic K-theory, AÂ¹ homotopy theory, and the theory of motives.  It was originally introduced by Yevsey Nisnevich, who was motivated by the theory of adeles.
